p: Tropical forests cover less than 10% of all land area (1.8 × 107 Km 2) [ 34] and over half of the tropical-forest area (1.1 × 107 Km 2) is represented by humid tropical forests (also called tropical rainforests) [ 35]. The Amazon basin contains the largest rainforest on Earth, almost 5.8 million Km 2, and occupies about 40% of South America; more than 60% of the basin is located in Brazil and the rest in Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, French Guiana, Guyana, Peru, Suriname and Venezuela.
